elements.name: Frage 1
elements.title: Canada wants to control a large part of immigration with this approach. Tick the category or categories of migrants who are affected by this according to Swiss usage.

elements.name: panel2
elements.title: Compare Canadian and Swiss migration policy by ticking all the statements that are correct. Correct any incorrect statements briefly and succinctly.

elements.name: Frage 2
elements.title: In Canada, the government has a great deal of freedom to decide how many migrants should enter the country each year. In Switzerland, this is not possible due to the bilateral agreements.

elements.name: Frage 3
elements.title: The Canadian points system is similar to the Swiss migration policy, which applies to migrants from non-EU/EFTA countries.

elements.name: Frage 4
elements.title: The Canadian points system is less clear/comprehensible for migrants than the Swiss migration policy, which applies to migrants from non-EU/EFTA countries.

elements.name: Korrektur 4
elements.title: Correction:
elements.correctAnswer: With the points system, the Canadian system is clearer/more transparent for migrants.

elements.name: Frage 5
elements.title: The Canadian points system would not really solve the problem of so-called economic migrants in Switzerland either, because most of these migrants from Africa and Asia would have no chance of achieving the required number of points.

elements.name: Frage 6
elements.title: The points system in Canada does not apply the principle of equality, but rather the principle of need and merit.

elements.name: question4
elements.title: Correction:
elements.correctAnswer: The points system corresponds to the merit principle, but not at all to the means-tested principle.
